identificationModule.briefTitle: Irbesartan in Heart Failure With Preserved Systolic Function (I-Preserve)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Irbesartan in Heart Failure With Preserved Systolic Function (I-Preserve)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if Irbesartan is superior to placebo in reducing mortality and cardiovascular morbidity in subjects with heart failure with preserved systolic function. The safety of this treatment will also be studied.

interventions.name: Irbesartan
interventions.description: Tablets, Oral, titration from 75 to 300 mg, once daily up to 6 years

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Tablets, Oral, titration from 75 to 300 mg, once daily up to 6 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With First Occurrence of the Composite Outcome of Death (All Cause) or Protocol-Specified Cardiovascular (CV) Hospitalization at Given Timepoints
primaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to first occurrence of composite outcome of all-cause death (composite outcome of death) or protocol-specified CV hospitalization. Protocol-specified CV hospitalizations include those ≥24 hrs or involving a calendar date change for a primary cause of worsening heart failure, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, ventricular or atrial dysrhythmia, or stroke, that also require intravenous or intramuscular therapy or a related procedure or significant augmentation of oral therapy. In addition, MI or stroke during any hospitalization are included.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Heart Failure Mortality or Heart Failure Hospitalization at Given Time Points
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to heart failure mortality or heart failure hospitalization

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Minnesota Living With Heart Failure (MLwHF) Total Score (Sum of Questions 1-21) at Month 6 and Month 14
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean score and adjusted mean change from baseline in Minnesota Living with Heart Failure (MLWHF) questionnaire, a 21-item, patient-reported, 6-point (ranging from 0-5; higher score=poorer quality of life; highest possible score=105) measurement of quality of life in persons with heart failure.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Minnesota Living With Heart Failure (MLwHF) Total Score (Sum of Questions 1-21) at Final Visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean score at baseline and final visit in Minnesota Living with Heart Failure (MLWHF) questionnaire, a 21-item, patient-reported, 6-point (ranging from 0-5; higher score=poorer quality of life; highest possible score=105) measurement of quality of life in persons with heart failure.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Final Visit=last scheduled visit specified in the protocol at conclusion of the entire study by the sponsor. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in B-Type Natriuretic Peptide (Pro-BNP) at Month 6 and Month 14
secondaryOutcomes.description: Adjusted ratio to baseline in geometric mean in Pro-BNP in the blood. Ratio to Baseline = On-therapy geometric mean divided by baseline geometric mean. A lower score signifies improvement. Change from baseline adjusted for baseline value and angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor use at baseline. Analysis uses natural logarithms of excretion rate values.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing CV Death, Non-Fatal Myocardial Infarction (MI), or Non-Fatal Stroke at Given Timepoints
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to cardiovascular death, non-fatal MI, or non-fatal stroke.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Cardiovascular Death at Given Timepoints
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to cardiovascular death

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing All-cause Death at Given Time Points
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to all-cause death

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in the New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Class at Month 6, Month 10, Month 14, and Final Visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: NYHA functional classification=4-tiered system relating symptoms to everyday activities \& quality of life. (See Reporting Groups for description of each class.) Change of NYHA functional class from baseline was grouped into 3 categories: improved, unchanged, or worsened (based on case report form \[CRF\] assessment). If a post-randomization CRF assessment was missing or participant died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the participant was classified as Major Event.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 10, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Physician Assessment of Heart Failure Status at Month 6, Month 14, and Final Visit Compared With Baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: This was an assessment of the change in overall physician opinion of change from baseline status. Assessments are directly based on the Case Report Form (CRF). If the post-randomization CRF assessment was missing and the subject died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure, or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the subject was considered as having a Major Event. Participants who are summarized under Major Events are categorized as Worsened Markedly.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Participant Assessment of Heart Failure Status at Month 6, Month 14, and Final Visit Compared With Baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessments are directly based on the Case Report Form (CRF). If the post-randomization CRF assessment was missing and the subject died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure, or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the subject was considered as having a Major Event. Participants who are summarized under Major Events are categorized as Worsened Markedly.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Participant Assessment of Fatigue at Month 6, Month 14, and Final Visit Compared With Baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessments are directly based on the Case Report Form (CRF). If the post-randomization CRF assessment was missing and the subject died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure, or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the subject was considered as having a Major Event. Participants who are summarized under Major Events are categorized as Worsened Markedly.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Participant Assessment of Dyspnea at Month 6, Month 14, and Final Visit Compared With Baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessments are directly based on the Case Report Form (CRF). If the post-randomization CRF assessment was missing and the subject died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure, or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the subject was considered as having a Major Event. Participants who are summarized under Major Events are categorized as Worsened Markedly.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing CV Death or CV Hospitalization at Given Timepoints
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to CV death or CV hospitalization. Protocol-specified CV hospitalizations include hospitalizations ≥24 hrs or involve a calendar date change for a primary cause of worsening heart failure, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, ventricular dysrhythmia, atrial dysrhythmia or stroke that also requires intravenous or intramuscular therapy or a related procedure or significant augmentation of oral therapy. Protocol specified CV hospitalizations also include myocardial infarction or stroke occurring during any hospitalization.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Protocol-specified Cardiovascular (CV) Hospitalization at Given Timepoints
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to protocol-specified CV hospitalization. Protocol-specified CV hospitalizations include hospitalizations ≥24 hrs or involve a calendar date change for a primary cause of worsening heart failure, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, ventricular dysrhythmia, atrial dysrhythmia or stroke that also requires intravenous or intramuscular therapy or a related procedure or significant augmentation of oral therapy. Protocol specified CV hospitalizations also include myocardial infarction or stroke occurring during any hospitalization.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With New Onset of Diabetes Among Subjects With No Prior Diabetes History at Given Timepoints
secondaryOutcomes.description: Treatment comparisons for time to new onset of diabetes (from adverse event reporting) among subjects with no prior history of diabetes.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) at Month 6, Month 18, and Month 30
secondaryOutcomes.description: Based on the Cockcroft-Gault formula calculation, a commonly used surrogate marker to estimate creatinine clearance, which in turn is an approximate measure of GFR. It employs serum creatinine measurements and a patient's weight to predict the creatinine clearance. Adjusted for baseline GFR and angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor use at baseline (ACE-I). A decrease from baseline signifies worsening. The adjusted mean change from baseline value is from the model (calculated prior to rounding), whereas the other two points are the baseline mean and post mean.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)at Month 42, Month 54, Month 66
secondaryOutcomes.description: Based on the Cockcroft-Gault formula calculation, a commonly used surrogate marker to estimate creatinine clearance, which in turn is an approximate measure of GFR. It employs serum creatinine measurements and a patient's weight to predict the creatinine clearance. Adjusted for baseline GFR and angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor use at baseline (ACE-I). A decrease from baseline signifies worsening. The adjusted mean change from baseline value is from the model (calculated prior to rounding), whereas the other two points are the baseline mean and post mean.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With New Onset Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Among Those With No Prior AF History or Evidence of AF on Baseline Electrocardiograph (ECG)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Frequency of new onset AF in participants with no prior AF history or evidence of AF on baseline ECG. Stratified by use of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors and measured by adverse events reporting and final ECG recording read by the investigator.

groups.title: Irbesartan
groups.description: titration from 75 to 300 mg, once daily (QD), up to 6 years

groups.description: titration from 75 to 300 mg, once daily (QD), up to 6 years

achievements.comment: Two participants were randomized but not treated; 1 randomized to irbesartan received placebo
One participant randomized to irbesartan received placebo.

groups.title: Irbesartan

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

classes.title: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

measures.title: New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class
measures.description: 1 participant in Placebo was not classified. NYHA Classes: I=No limitation of physical activity (does not cause undue fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea). II=Slight limitation of physical activity (comfortable at rest, ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea). III=Marked limitation of physical activity (comfortable at rest, less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea). IV=Unable to carry out any physical activity without discomfort (symptoms of cardiac insufficiency at rest; discomfort is increased if any physical activity is undertaken).

measures.title: B-Type Natriuretic Peptide (Pro-BNP)
measures.description: Participant population=those participants with a baseline Pro-BNP measurement. Irbesartan (n=1765), Placebo (n=1798), Total (n=3563)

outcomeMeasures.description: Treatment comparisons for time to first occurrence of composite outcome of all-cause death (composite outcome of death) or protocol-specified CV hospitalization. Protocol-specified CV hospitalizations include those ≥24 hrs or involving a calendar date change for a primary cause of worsening heart failure, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, ventricular or atrial dysrhythmia, or stroke, that also require intravenous or intramuscular therapy or a related procedure or significant augmentation of oral therapy. In addition, MI or stroke during any hospitalization are included.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in the New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Class at Month 6, Month 10, Month 14, and Final Visit
outcomeMeasures.description: NYHA functional classification=4-tiered system relating symptoms to everyday activities \& quality of life. (See Reporting Groups for description of each class.) Change of NYHA functional class from baseline was grouped into 3 categories: improved, unchanged, or worsened (based on case report form \[CRF\] assessment). If a post-randomization CRF assessment was missing or participant died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the participant was classified as Major Event.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Randomized participants with measurement at baseline and Month 6, Month 10, Month 14, and Final Visit
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 10, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

groups.title: Irbesartan Baseline Class I or II
groups.description: Class I (Mild): No limitation of physical activity. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea (shortness of breath). Class II (Mild): Slight limitation of physical activity. Comfortable at rest, but ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea.

groups.title: Irbesartan Class III or IV
groups.description: Class III (Moderate): Marked limitation of physical activity. Comfortable at rest, but less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea. Class IV (Severe): Unable to carry out any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms of cardiac insufficiency at rest. If any physical activity is undertaken, discomfort is increased.

groups.title: Placebo Baseline Class I or II

outcomeMeasures.title: Physician Assessment of Heart Failure Status at Month 6, Month 14, and Final Visit Compared With Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: This was an assessment of the change in overall physician opinion of change from baseline status. Assessments are directly based on the Case Report Form (CRF). If the post-randomization CRF assessment was missing and the subject died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure, or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the subject was considered as having a Major Event. Participants who are summarized under Major Events are categorized as Worsened Markedly.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

outcomeMeasures.title: Participant Assessment of Dyspnea at Month 6, Month 14, and Final Visit Compared With Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Assessments are directly based on the Case Report Form (CRF). If the post-randomization CRF assessment was missing and the subject died, was hospitalized for worsening heart failure, or discontinued study medication for worsening heart failure, the subject was considered as having a Major Event. Participants who are summarized under Major Events are categorized as Worsened Markedly.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, Month 6, Month 14, Final Visit. The trial was designed to end after 1440 primary endpoint events, projected duration=6.0 ± 0.5 years.

groups.title: Irbesartan
groups.description: titration from 75 to 300 mg, once daily (QD), up to 6 years

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: titration from 75 to 300 mg, once daily (QD), up to 6 years

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing CV Death or CV Hospitalization at Given Timepoints
outcomeMeasures.description: Treatment comparisons for time to CV death or CV hospitalization. Protocol-specified CV hospitalizations include hospitalizations ≥24 hrs or involve a calendar date change for a primary cause of worsening heart failure, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, ventricular dysrhythmia, atrial dysrhythmia or stroke that also requires intravenous or intramuscular therapy or a related procedure or significant augmentation of oral therapy. Protocol specified CV hospitalizations also include myocardial infarction or stroke occurring during any hospitalization.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Protocol-specified Cardiovascular (CV) Hospitalization at Given Timepoints
outcomeMeasures.description: Treatment comparisons for time to protocol-specified CV hospitalization. Protocol-specified CV hospitalizations include hospitalizations ≥24 hrs or involve a calendar date change for a primary cause of worsening heart failure, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, ventricular dysrhythmia, atrial dysrhythmia or stroke that also requires intravenous or intramuscular therapy or a related procedure or significant augmentation of oral therapy. Protocol specified CV hospitalizations also include myocardial infarction or stroke occurring during any hospitalization.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With New Onset of Diabetes Among Subjects With No Prior Diabetes History at Given Timepoints
outcomeMeasures.description: Treatment comparisons for time to new onset of diabetes (from adverse event reporting) among subjects with no prior history of diabetes.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Randomized participants with no prior diabetes history

groups.title: Irbesartan

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: titration from 75 to 300 mg, once daily (QD), up to 6 years

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) at Month 6, Month 18, and Month 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Based on the Cockcroft-Gault formula calculation, a commonly used surrogate marker to estimate creatinine clearance, which in turn is an approximate measure of GFR. It employs serum creatinine measurements and a patient's weight to predict the creatinine clearance. Adjusted for baseline GFR and angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor use at baseline (ACE-I). A decrease from baseline signifies worsening. The adjusted mean change from baseline value is from the model (calculated prior to rounding), whereas the other two points are the baseline mean and post mean.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants with baseline score and score at timepoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)at Month 42, Month 54, Month 66
outcomeMeasures.description: Based on the Cockcroft-Gault formula calculation, a commonly used surrogate marker to estimate creatinine clearance, which in turn is an approximate measure of GFR. It employs serum creatinine measurements and a patient's weight to predict the creatinine clearance. Adjusted for baseline GFR and angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor use at baseline (ACE-I). A decrease from baseline signifies worsening. The adjusted mean change from baseline value is from the model (calculated prior to rounding), whereas the other two points are the baseline mean and post mean.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With New Onset Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Among Those With No Prior AF History or Evidence of AF on Baseline Electrocardiograph (ECG)
outcomeMeasures.description: Frequency of new onset AF in participants with no prior AF history or evidence of AF on baseline ECG. Stratified by use of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors and measured by adverse events reporting and final ECG recording read by the investigator.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Randomized subjects (total=4128) with no prior AF history or evidence of AF on baseline ECG, stratified by use of ACE-I

classes.title: No prior AF history or Evidence on Baseline ECG
Participants with New Onset Atrial Fibrillation

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
